page.title: 06Employment:Chatteris
page.content: Between 1971 and 1981 the population has increased from 5583 to 6180, an increase of{10.7%}which is higher than Fenland as a whole(under 4%). Male unemployment has increased during the same period from 3.6% to 9.6% whilst female unemployment changed relatively little, increasing from 5.8% to 6.2% although much of this work is seasonal. Our survey showed that Whitworth's Produce and Stainless Metalcraft are the largest employers in Chatteris. 25% of all males worked in engineering. Other large areas of male employment were haulage, farming and clerical work. Female workers were most common in vegetable packing and clerical work. People{travel}as far as Cambridge and Peterborough each day to work and many larger firms provide transport for their employees.
